review_text: Wonderful hosts. The house is situated in a nice neighborhood. Lovely balcony off the kitchen to chill on. Hugh dining room table to accommodate my laptops or a kid or two. Upstairs library is awesome. I wasn’t there long enough to throughly enjoy. They were kind to let me park my car in the back off the street. Which meant a lot to me. Very accommodating.
Jeff was really friendly and the apartment was great! I enjoyed walking around Gloversville and seeing all the beautiful Victorian architecture !

Jeff’s place was a nice spot to rest on our way to Buffalo. As described and shown in the photos. The attic is very cool and such a cute unique touch. So much to look at. Jeff was flexible with our arrival time and left the light on for us to find at night. This felt like staying at a friend’s home. Nothing too fancy! (I really appreciate the apple juice, as someone who has low blood sugar in the morning… 😊)

Jeff's place is well situated as jumping off spot for adk adventures- fire towers, lake, trails, and mountain biking networks are all close by. Stores and shops are walkable. While the place is on the older side, it is HUGE and clean. Would definitely come back with some friends to make use of the space in the warmer months.
This place was perfect for the short stay. Thank you very much!
The stay was very pleasant. Thank you very much!
Jeff was responsive to our concerns.
Jeff’s place was perfect for our weekend trip. A group of us were in town to visit friends. The size and price for Jeff’s place accommodated our needs perfectly.
It was relaxing and fun

Thank you, Jeff, and had a nice time in Gloversville - very convenient location to downtown Gloversville and main highways.
Sue
Great communication, easy access upon arrival, plenty of space, and a great value. Thank you!
Fantastic host and great place to stay with my 2 young kids and our dog!
Great place for me and my dogs - way more space than expected.
Our stay was nice and peaceful the apartment was beautiful and cozy.
we came late, was a wonderful place
Jeff is a great host. Always helpful and available. The Place is as described and seen on the pictures.
Need couple of upgrade in kitchen and bathroom
Great Deal! Super cool bookstore in the attic! Enjoyed our stay!
We had a very good time in Jeff’s apartment, the kids liked it very much, especially the bookstore upstairs and the little room with the toys. We felt very welcome and safe.
Great spot, had a cool loft with books but didn't get to check it out. Grab some pizza from the pizza joint down the street!
Nice little place to stay with bookstore up top!
Great location. Comfortable, well stocked, super friendly, responsive hosts - would definitely stay again!
Everything was as listed. Great stay!
Great place to relax!!!
Jeff was very responsive and a wonderful host. His place was a great jumping off place for our upstate adventures. The supplies for a dinner and breakfast were a wonderful surprise. Thank you Jeff!
5 beam

Jeff was an excellent host, he was very polite and respectful very reasonable and reliable having many conversations throughout the mornings, and afternoon I got a chance to meet some new people who were very welcoming and my children best of all were more than satisfied with the space and peaceful setting Jeff’s place made them feel he provided information about the city and where we might find a Walmart his wife even offered a camp fire for my children to join in and roast marshmallows I would definitely recommend this place to anyone I would definitely stay again
I really like this place
Enjoyed our stay again. We love the space and location is great.
Lots of space
The place was fine, it was just very hot the first few nights. Jeff was easy to work with and always responsive.
Great spot to stay with our kids while visiting family. Clean, comfortable, quiet spot. Thanks for another great stay!
Jeff is a fine host. The place is very spacious warm in the winter and stocked with everything you need.!
Jeff was very friendly and welcoming. The home was beautiful comfortable and had everyone we needed.

Felt right at home. Bed in the front room is super comfortable. Owner had a small starter meal selection and cookware available I was able to make several dishes while I was there. Owners are super nice and accommodating. The location is great and close to local businesses/ restaurants. Definitely will visit again
Jeff was a great host would recommend anybody to stay with him very accommodating will be back soon

Jeff’s place was very spacious and had everything we needed for our week long stay. It has four bedrooms with a very large master bedroom. Plenty of room for our family of four plus our big dogs. The kitchen has everything you need to stay in and make dinner. They even had snacks, drinks, different little dry and canned foods, pancake mix and syrup. They brought up extra supplies if we needed them as well. We have two large dogs and two silly kids and I was afraid we were constantly being loud since it was on the second floor, but they never complained and were always friendly. Jeff even offered for us to get together one evening, but we were so busy we didn’t have time. I’ve never had such a friendly host. We would definitely stay there again, and would recommend for a quick trip or a longer stay.

Jeff and Theresa were very responsive and made it easy to stay with them! The house itself is old and a little worn and dirty in some spots, but it has plenty of space, a well-equipped kitchen, and a convenient location for us. We will stay with them again next time we are in town!
Great stay
Had my employees staying there for a project Jeff was a great host to them. I would recommend staying with Jeff we will be back.
This was our second stay and it was just as good as the first. Jeff is super accommodating and easy to contact. The location is perfect for our needs and super spacious. Highly recommend!
was great
Great place. Large spacious apartment perfect location from the Fonda speedway. It was great to bring our family pet. We will definitely book again

It was relaxing to just be able to kick back and stretch our legs. As truck drivers, we rarely get the chance so it was definitely appropriated. They were very attentive hosts and had everything we could need with no complaints. Would absolutely recommend!

This was one of the best AirBnB stays I've had! Self check-in/check-out was a breeze. My friends and I were a little worried we would block the other cars in the driveway, but thankfully it was wide enough to fit our car and still allow other cars to back out. The place was spacious and homey, and with a bedroom for each of us, we definitely felt like we were getting more than our money's worth. Teresa and Jeff were gracious with the amenities, including paper plates and plastic silverware (which made clean up easier since we had fewer dishes to wash), hand and bath towels, coffee, and snacks. The master bedroom even has a cute baby playpen in case you bring a little one. We love the bookstore in the attic, too. Wish our trip was longer so we could have enjoyed the space more!
Great place to stay if your visiting Gloversville, NY area
Jeff and Theresa were super helpful in a pinch when our other reservation fell through. It was a quaint apartment conveniently close to the downtown area. The apartment had everything we needed.
Jeff is a Great host. Property is as described,and Jeff is always there if you need anything. We missed not seeing Teresa this time! Look forward to the next stay.
Great stay..handy stop off on way to Saratoga. great value. very comfortable..spacious place..lots of nice small touches

Our family stayed here with our dog and it worked out great! The space was the perfect size for all of us and we were grateful to be right on the street/sidewalk access to walk our dog around. We also appreciated having the bookstore upstairs from us - a unique perk for our stay! We definitely recommend Jeff and Theresa's place and would gladly come back for another visit :)

Spacious apartment in a quiet neighborhood. Access was easy. Breakfast snacks and fresh fruit were great. It wasn‘t an issue for us but be aware that it is in the second floor with moderately steep steps.
large living room. coffee pods and some snacks are provided which is nice
The home is huge, well equipped. We only stayed for one night but it was great. There were many treats for guests, fruits and snacks.
A large, comfortable space with great hosts. It met our needs wonderfully.

very nice place with lots of space and personal touches. the hosts were very responsive and the library was pretty neat. I do recommend this place, but it is listed with no a/c and you should keep that in mind when booking in the summer months.
It is very nice and comfortable place. However, there was no AC and it was very hot and unpleasant to be in the apartment

The Airbnb was lovely. It was very spacious and nicely located. It was well stocked. My family of 4 enjoyed our two night stay. Jeff was even so kind as to let us borrow 2 chairs to bring with us to an outdoor concert. We would definitely return. They have an attic filled with books that we made a purchase from. They have an adorable dog named Buster that was not a bother at all. The only improvement we could make would be adding A/C but there were plenty of fans to help cool things down. Overall a fabulous stay.
This place is ok, but it’s a work in progress. Very nice hosts. air conditioning would be my first upgrade to the property, and it could be cleaner.

Jeff and Theresa's place is a very large, light, clean second floor apartment in a great walking neighborhood, near to "down town" where we stumbled upon FoodTruck Friday at the Main Street park - good live music and great food options; Gloversville has a few interesting shops, a food co-op and galleries.

This is a very large unit, in a lovely village. The deck of the kitchen is a nice spot for a cup of tea or a morning coffee. We were 4 women traveling from a concert in Saratoga Springs and this was the perfect rest up before we continued our road trip back home. Highly recommend this very large space!
Tons of space! The free breakfast (oatmeal, juice boxes, pastries) was great! This unique older home has everything we needed and the host answered my many questions promptly. Thanks!
This is my second time staying here and it’s just as good as the first time. Place is very clean and huge. Very quick response time by host and smooth easy check in. Would highly recommend
Jeff and Theresa thank you guys for hosting me and my family. I would come back again.
Very spacious and beautiful place. Location is perfect giving its close to town. Very clean and very attentive communication with Jeff as host! I highly recommend this place!

Great location, easily accessible. The apartment was very clean, well stocked with everything we could possibly need, snacks too! The bed was comfortable and there were plenty of fans to deal with the unseasonable warm temperatures we were experiencing in the Northeast. Jeff was a very accommodating host and I would definitely stay at his place again.

Such a beautiful old home. Loved everything about it and the dogs enjoyed the little porch to sit and watch people go by. Super easy to check in and out. We will 100% be back to stay again. Also go and check out the bookstore upstairs you won’t be disappointed- I know I wasn’t!

Great stay. The place is huge! Very clean, very comfy bed with cosy duvet, full kitchen-- really everything you need. I thought the listing said 2 bedrooms, but there were THREE and even a baby crib if you need that.
Very quiet night and day, safe neighbourhood, about 4 blocks from a park for walking your dog (but also of course many lovely trails in the area). Easy parking right in front. Also-- wonderfully-- included is private access to a little honour-system used bookshop in the attic above! Would stay again for sure.
Great place to stay has an awesome bookstore dealt with my crazy noisy family will definitely be back
This is an extraordinary home. Spacious home with a great secret attic space for a whole family to enjoy. We will be back!
Excellent service. Very comfortable, clean, clean, accessible. The treatment of Jeff and his wife, excellent, very attentive. We are grateful. We are planning to return soon.
Nice host
Great spot to stay! Comfortable, quiet, and cozy- perfect if you have kids! We had a family dinner here and it was great.
Great place and hosts amazing communication.
Jeff is a very nice person. show us all the room. Room are all warmer.
Great place for the price, very charming & spacious

A simple, spacious, budget option on your way to Adirondacks adventures. No frills but cozy. All the frying pans are old scratched teflon ones. Advised the host to throw them out. In general, would stay again.
everything was as expected. Truly recommend.

A spacious, comfortable place to spend the night. We love old victorian houses, and many thoughtful touches helped us feel at home. The little bookstore and reading space in the loft was very intriguing. I'm sorry I didn't have time to explore further.
We had a very nice one-week visit. It is a convenient location with lots of room to make a nice home away from home. Jeff was very accommodating and provided everything we needed.
Good location for Lapland Lake, easy communication. Will come again.
Great place to stay we just stopped for the night but it was exactly what we wanted!
Clean, welcoming and very family friendly. Lots of sweet touches and amenities that made the stay extra special. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Our family of 4 spent Christmas there to visit family and it was perfect for us. Very spacious, decorated for Christmas, and great responsiveness and communication with the owners downstairs. The only draw back for us was the steep flight of stairs to get to the unit but only because we have small children to navigate it and require a lot of “stuff” for a 5 day stay. Overall it was awesome!

Jeff and Theresa are amazing hosts. They have thought of every little detail to make your stay a stress free and wonderful experience. We stayed during the holiday season and they had the apartment decorated for Christmas. Was so nice talking to Jeff. Definitely visit his bookstore in the attic of the house!
Lovely home in a quiet town. Great to rest for the night. Hosts thought of everything you could need.

Great spot if the Gloversville area is where you need or want to be!!! It was an absolutely huge apartment and a great deal for the price! If you are not a fan of older homes, this may not be the place for you. However, I loved it! It reminded me of my family’s home(s) back in Maine.
With an old home comes old fixtures, doors and floors. Things may not be even and the bathroom door may not have locks but it’s a really cool older home! If you are looking for a rustic stay, this is a great choice. It had snowed the day we travelled to NY and I got a really neat picture of the neighborhood at night with snow. I wish I could share it with you all.
There is a fantastic dining room table and chairs that could easily seat 6-8 people. That was fantastic for us as my beau has a whole pack of children! 😀. We were able to bring Thanksgiving leftovers with us and have a nice dinner with the littles. Oh! And the fruit basket was such a nice touch! Thank you Jeff and Theresa!
Be sure to bring your own bath towels, wash cloths etc as I didn’t find any. Having had multiple Air B and B stays, I knew that could be a possibility so I had brought my own.
All of the beds have sheets, blankets and pillows but, if you are picky about your bedding, you may want to bring your own. The bedding here is/was just fine … just may not be what you are used to at your own home. I have been to Air B and Bs where it was required to bring your own bedding which is why I choose to review the bedding.
The kitchen had a small assortment of cooking utensils, as well as pots and pans. They had dishes and eating utensils, as well. The full sized stove with oven was a nice feature, as was the microwave and Keurig. These will be great when we return as eating out with a bunch of children can get expensive. The snacks, juice boxes and oatmeal were a neat touch, as well.
The host greeted us at the door and even assisted me in carrying my dog crate upstairs. Fantastic! We chatted a bit about our military service … yup … Veteran owned Air B and B, if that matters to any of you.
Unfortunately, this was just an overnight for us so I was unable to check out their bookstore upstairs but sure want to next time.
I don’t think you can go wrong with this property. I am looking forward to our next stay there!

This is a great place to stay lots of room and the hosts provide everything you could possibly think of in an Airbnb. The home is conveniently located close to main st. in Gloversville. The home has an amazing book store located in the attic.
a quiet place to rest
Nice place to crash for a night or two. The kitchen sink has seen better days and I hate that the bathroom doesn't have a lock on it. Otherwise, it was a great stay.
Spacious casual space.
House is immaculate and HUGE . Host are AMAZING. Very close and Conveniently located.
What a great place! Super spacious and a fantastic location when visiting the Adirondacks! I can’t wait to visit again!
Absolutely amazing place to stay plenty of room, great hosts definitely great value
Large space with plenty of room for guests, much more than my wife and I needed for the weekend.
Great place, convenient to anything you need and the hosts are very nice and quick to communicate.

The apartment is really spacious. It worked well for our needs which was a quick overnight. We arrived late and left early. It was hot upstairs but the provided fans seemed to be enough to keep us comfortable. The furniture and beds were comfortable and space was clean. Arrival and departure worked out without issue. We appreciated being able to make coffee before getting back on the road.

Very spacious apartment upstairs in older home. Everything works fine, and is nothing fancy. The basics provided in the kitchen with snacks, too. My band was playing in town, so we appreciated each member having our own room. Lots of room to spread out.

This was our favorite airbnb! Lovely older home with huge rooms. The host and hostess respond to any requests quickly and the creams were a thoughtful addition to the keurig coffee. We had a wonderful stay, definitely want to come again!
Very large, spacious place. Clean, comfortable, and worth it. Great communication from the host in advance.

My friend and I had an excellent, relaxing time during our one night day. With all the fans and windows, and a night evening rainstorm, we did fine without A/C. We used the Roku provided on the TV and enjoyed Hulu access. Parking was easy and the neighborhood was very calm and safe. It felt personally cozy, like a family vacation home.

Pros: spacious (4 bedrooms), great value, close to the mountains, super host, breakfast goodies
Cons: No a/c, which is fine most days but a few hot summer days could be uncomfortable
Awesome place! Four bedrooms, huge living room, huge kitchen, a nice little balcony, and it’s all very nice and comfortable. This is definitely a great place to relax. I highly recommend this AirBnB!
Stayed there with our family of 6. Plenty of space, and the fruit bowl and breakfast foods were a perfect touch! Great for our one night need.

This is a fantastic place to stay if you need quite a bit of room. There are four bedrooms total which was perfect for my husband and I, our three kids, and my mom. The living room is perfect for playing and hanging out, and the space is very nice. Our only struggle was the lack of air-conditioning. On cooler nights it was fine, but there were several very hot nights where it was extremely uncomfortable to be in the apartment. If do you need a good amount of space this will be a great option for you! As long as the weather forecast doesn’t look too hot. 😅
Very friendly family that is very accomodating.
Our stay at Jeff’s place was great! They were very responsive and accommodating. It was a large space at a great value.
Very nice clean place.

Very spacious and clean! There is no AC but there are fans. Jeff znd Theresa were prompt with all communication met us upin arrival and provided us with fresh fruit and a grab and go breakfast! We enjoyed our brief stay!

Charmed a little apartment old fashioned wish it had more than one tv. This apartment is good to spend the night not a hang out apartment. The light going into the apartment (the steps) did not work, and the lights leading into the door to go in the place did not work. Overall you get what you pay for.

Not much to choose from in Gloversville and surrounding area. Four bedroom apartment. Good place for family. As of now fix, it needs air conditioner in some windows due to summer heat. The owners are great people. Willing to help when you have needs. Thanks for the “Blue Book. “

Jeff and Theresa are very welcoming and the apartment is HUGE with lots of charm. We especially appreciated the extra hospitable touches they left of snacks and toiletries. We will definitely stay with them again next time we are in Gloversville.
Very nice place and jeff was great host stay there again

Jeff is really nice and considerate. He responded to my inquiries quickly. His place is located in a quiet and nice neighborhood, just 5 minutes walking to the downtown. This place is specious, my children and I enjoyed our stay. We all appreciated the fruit bowl and breakfast options provided! Highly recommended.

We stayed in Jeff's and Theresa's house over the memorial day weekend. It was an old house in a quiet neighborhood. Everything was very clean and as expected. Jeff and Theresa were very nice and helpful. When I asked if they have large pots and large trays for the oven, they actually got them for me, which was very nice of them. Jeff also gave me some good tips where to go hiking in Adirondacks. We had a great time, the trip worked out quite well.
Great guy and great place

This place is freshly painted and super clean. There is lots of space and this would be great for a family. there were three of and we enjoyed the spaciousness of the bedrooms, the living room and the dining room. the hosts, Jeff and Theresa, are very helpful and hospitable. There were lots of amenities in the bathroom and kitchen, a beautiful fruit bowl and nice breakfast options, Netflix and Hulu. The mattresses were super comfortable. Street parking in a safe neighborhood - we would definitely stay here again.
wonderful spot! highly recommend
Williams’s place looks really nice and we enjoyed our stay. Would recommend!
We didn’t stay long as it was a pit stop in our travels, but we had such a great experience that we’d use the place every time over a hotel. Plus, our dog loved the place, so that’s always a win!

William is the perfect host with a lovely space. He communicates quickly to answer any questions or needs as they arise. The space was perfect for 4 adults to spend a couple days away, who had no interest or need to cook. The kitchenette was small, but just right for the 4 of us to sit together and enjoy our morning coffee. Our host even supplied some freshly ground coffee from beans that come from a local shop. My favorite part of the property and our visit was the gorgeous landscaping and koi pond with sitting area in the back yard. We sat each evening around the pond and enjoyed beverages and conversation. William also gave an amazing tour of the rest of the home, which is STUNNING, and gave the history of the house and it's family. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect location, host, and property for our needs! We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!

William's place was phenomenal. The home and gardens are very beautiful. The accommodations are everything that you can ask for including very beautiful and comfortable bedrooms, interesting and well thought out decor, and elegant bathrooms. The area is very walkable and the neighborhood is wonderful. William and Wally were very kind and generous. I highly recommend their home and Johnstown.
A lovely home with friendly and accommodating hosts!!
Thank you for hosting us, we had a wonderful stay.

We absolutely loved staying at William's property. The property itself is gorgeous, beautifully maintained and cared for. The accommodations were so comfortable and all the little details (such as the little satchels of lavender on the bed posts), really made this place special.
Highly recommended!
William was great. We only stayed one night while passing through, but the place was lovely and William was very helpful. Thanks!
It was great but the stairs to bedroom need to be in description and emphasized. Great place to stay and great hosts
Such a sweet place with beautiful decor, super comfy beds and quality linens. Very kind and gracious hosts.

William’s place is just beautiful. The decorations and the ambience was like being in a different era, a real experience. The location is quiet and in a beautiful neighborhood. Bathrooms are beautiful, clean and spacious and William was quick to respond to any questions and incredibly polite.

William’s place is a hidden gem. Immaculately cleaned and decorated, located in a relaxing rural neighborhood (we woke up to roosters), with Saratoga Springs just a 40 min drive away. Would highly recommend this property to family and friends (as long as they are okay with stairs as they are quite steep). Thanks for an amazing stay!

Safe and inviting neighborhood to walk around day or night time.
Great recommendations for food, activities, and a perfect location and setting to relax and unwind.
Very friendly and attentive hosts who treated us like family.
We look forward on a return visit with high recommendations to stay here again.

I highly recommend William's place. I would absolutely stay there again, or even look for a reason to come back so I could stay again. It was stocked with everything we could need and even a lot that we wouldn't expect. The hosts were friendly and helpful, and a delight to meet, and they welcomed our Beagle like she was family. It is a beautiful and very comfortable house and the furnishings were top notch. The bed in our room was one of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept on - some type of layered memory foam that was more comfortable than our Tempur-Pedic at home. There is a set of slightly steep wooden stairs to the bedrooms that might be limiting for people with issues with stairs, but that is the only possible negative. Highly recommended!!
A beautiful home and very gracious hosts :) perfect for a last minute Xc ski getaway
We had an excellent stay! The house is beautiful and easy to find. It's in a quiet neighborhood and made for an easy nights rest!
Very quaint space. Clean and well stocked. Great hosts! Would definitely return again.
Great stay on short notice. Would recommend!
Bill was an amazing host. He was very responsive and helpful with our questions. The house was small but we felt it was well worth the price!

really nice place the funny thing is we only live a half a mile away but was a great vac the only thing i would suggest is to bring like folding setting chairs (like lawn) i am a bigger person so the small card table type chairs were not comfortable to plat board games cards or puzzles even eating dinner but if you are small its all good there are tables outside but it was early mat and it rained they were wet so i guess you could bring in the outside ones there are 8 of them
Chantale is a superb host....the very best.

Chantelle’s pool house is so much fun. The water is blissfully warm and the house itself is adorable and exactly as described. Imagine being able to float around on a raft while watching cat videos on Youtube at midnight in the privacy of your very own pool house. If this sounds like your type of getaway then Chantelle’s pool house is perfect. The decks and grounds around her house are also lovely and peaceful. And if you’re lucky you’ll get to hang with pups Bronx and Belmont. Can’t wait to come back in the summer time and swim with all the sliding doors open and eat all my meals on the awesome deck. The only thing I would warn you about is the spiral staircase is quite steep and a tad scary coming down. The only bathroom is also downstairs so if you’re someone who is quite clumsy (or has toddlers) or tends to need to use the bathroom in the middle of the night, this may not be the setup for you.

This place was such a wonderful getaway! The pool is huge and the temperature was perfect. We had so much fun swimming! The place as a whole is very clean, comfortable and had everything we needed. Chantale was so kind and truly just wanted us to have a great time. One of the best things about this place was her sweet pups! An unexpected surprise was that if you wanted to, they can come into the space and hang out! Bronx was my cuddle buddy a couple mornings. He is so sweet! Overall we had an amazing time and made some great memories. My son says he definitely wants to come back and I agree!

This was our second time staying at Chantale’s Air BNB and we had a fantastic time again! We can’t wait to go again! 😊 Chantale is welcoming in every aspect, she is a great host! The place of stay is amazing! We can’t wait to make more memories at this air bnb!

Chantale and the Poolhouse’s are amazing! There is nothing else like this treasure. It’s the perfect family vacation for anyone who loves a warm water pool. The care and commitment by Chantale is simply outstanding. You will be treated like royalty.

The stay was amazing. The pool house was clean and comfortable and had everything we needed. Chantal’s explained everything clearly when we got there, plan for fifteen minutes with her when you arrive! We had some amazing food delivered and swam and relaxed the whole time. Beautiful rural surroundings, but easy to get to! Highly recommend!

My family and I had a wonderful experience staying at Chantale's Airbnb. Her place was so cool - a feat of engineering and ingenuity! It was a top notch experience start to finish. Chantale was such a warm and welcoming host. It was clear that a lot of thought and effort was put into providing a comfortable environment and a considerable amount of amenities for guests. Chantale was very responsive and readily available if assistance was need. As luck would have it, we stayed during the freak spring snow storm. (It was very memorable to get to swim inside while it snowed outside). Our hosts went above and beyond to accomodate us by ensuring that the walk and driveway were clear of snow in time for departure. We wouldn't hesitate to return!
Chantale was an amazing host. Every detail was taken care of. The space was beautiful and the pool was perfect. We had a great time and would love to come back.

This was a truly amazing place to stay. I was worried that it might feel like the pool area in a YMCA, but Chantale has everything set up to take care of the humidity, and the air and temp were so pleasant. She had great communication about taking care of the pool house and making sure we were having a great time, but it never felt intrusive. Such a treat to be able to jump in the pool whenever we wanted! It was the perfect place. The pool was good exercise, so you're tired enough at night to get a good night's sleep. The king size bed was actually comfortable!! In other places we've stayed, it felt like someone might've put their old bed in the air bnb. Not here! It was better than my sleep number I have at home. :) I can't say enough good. If you're on the fence about staying here, just do it. You won't regret it! :)
My family had the best time! Such a beautiful space with every last detail thought of.

Peaceful but fun family time! If you need time away from life this is the place!! You have everything you need and more! The pool was our main attraction, warm, clean, and packed with fun toys. Kids were overjoyed and we found the big TV was nice for relaxing at night too. Also watching basketball while in the pool! The space is clean for obvious but most importantly two reasons 1. Guests have respected the space and listened to her (simple) rules. 2. Chantale has the HVAC down to a science to keep you and your family safe and comfortable. I loved the kitchen, we ate in and got take out bc we didn’t want to leave the space! We went out bowling one day and to an aquarium 40 min away. Chantale, thanks for your kindness, it goes a long way!

With over 50 AirBnB stays, this is the ONLY one we've ever booked twice. Chantale's property is a true treat and she's one of the BEST Airbnb hosts I've had the privilege of meeting. The unique and incredibly relaxing pool, thoughtful touches and quiet surroundings make this a trip you won't forget. I'm a huge dog lover and getting to play with the pups will always be a highlight. So happy to also see Chantel's handmade wares also available to browse and purchase - she's so talented and we wanted it all! Can't wait to come again for a third time.

Chantale was absolutely amazing!! extremely friendly. She recommended places to eat and take the kids to have fun. Her pool house is extremely clean and tons of fun!! Oh and her dog Belmont and Bronx are absolutely amazing and very friendly. We will definitely be booking again!! Thank you so much Chantale for wonderful hospitality!!

It was a perfect little getaway for my family before our newest addition arrives. The pool was fantastic and so warm. My kids said it was the best day ever everyday we were there and gave it a 10/10. We can’t wait to book again! Chantale was an amazing host and made us feel right at home.

I'm conflicted about writing this review as I want to rant and rave about it, but selfishly, I don't want to draw more people in, so I have more future possibilities to stay here! I stayed with my son and two of his friends to celebrate his 13th birthday, and it was beyond amazeballs! Chantale was super sweet and accommodating. She went over everything thoroughly and clearly when we got there, and then we got total privacy with the occasional text (which wasn't a problem for me). Covering and uncovering the pool was super easy once you got a hang of it and was so worth it to keep the water nice and warm! The only thing that wasn't there was the air fryer that was in the photos of the kitchen, but I'm sure if I asked Chantale about it, she would have brought one or accommodated the best way she could. She truly was that wonderful of a host, and I don't give that kind of praise lightly. I don't stay in airbnb's typically more than once, but this one will be the exception!

My partner and I stayed at this Airbnb with our dog for a week in mid-June, and we had friends visit throughout our time there. This rental is located on a small, beautiful and serene lake just within the Adirondack Park. The view from the backyard and master bedroom was amazing and the setting felt very intimate. The direct lake access on the property was excellent and the new dock with patio set and umbrella, canoe, paddle boat, fire pit, and patio with picnic table and grill with gas line were wonderful, convenient amenities for our week. We brought our own tubes and speaker had a lot of fun floating in the water and listening to music, grilling, eating all of our meals on the dock or patio, and sitting by the campfire and watching the lake and stars at night. The property is located on the west side of the lake, so we imagine the sunrises to the east are beautiful and the sun was available on the lake by property until about 5 or 6pm. After that, it gets chilly so you might want to get out of the water and paddle or float to a sunny area.
There is a small community located around the edge of the lake. Overall, the neighbors were friendly and curious about us. There isn't a path to walk around the edge of lake, but you can paddle or float around. Around the right shore from the property you can paddle to a small and beautiful concrete dam area and have a picnic. We recommend bringing camping chairs for that and the firepit.
This is the type of place it makes sense to bring everything you need for the week and enjoy the lake. Stores are about 10 minutes away for anything forgotten or needed, and it seems like the hosts may be living nearby at times if you need them. On a rainy, cool, or cloudy day, other attractions are about an hour away. We really enjoyed visiting the restaurants and parks in Saratoga Springs, about a 50 minute drive.
The owners recently bought the property and restored it. We were the first to rent it. The outside is cute and quaint and the new electric, plumping, appliances, and fixtures work well. The interior is hunting cabin meets cottage meets under the sea meets nautical meets Atlantic City glam.
The owners have put a lot of energy, time, and other resources into restoring the property and are still working out the kinks, on finishing it, and keeping the listing up-to-date with changes. The lawn, landscaping, floors, and outdoor stairs were the main things that needed to be finished. This was our first Adirondack vacation and I don’t think we could have picked a better spot.

Our accommodations were just what we were looking for quiet, peaceful, a beautiful lake to sit back and watch or you could spend many hours fishing. The floors were exceptionally clean as well as the whole cottage. Even the towels and bedding smelled fresh. We used the kayaks and had a lot of fun but we mostly used the boat and got around the whole lake fishing in the week we were there. We caught abundant bass, pickerel, and black crappies in many sizes and released them for someone else to have some fun. Two young ground hogs were outside the kitchen window each morning getting their first meal for the day and we were not sure how many beavers but did see one every night swimming somewhere. We never found the beaver den though. What an enjoyable vacation and hoping to come back in the future!

It’s a great , clean house with amazing blessed view , where it can be find everyting needed for a lovely stay!
We love very much the place and we took good care of it, leaving it clean and everything organized as we found it.
Thank you and we looking forward to come again!
Radu Livadaru
it was a great place for relaxing and beautiful views

We wanted a peaceful lakeside cabin and that's exactly what we got at the Sleepy Loon. The setting was utterly breathtaking. The cabin itself was like a home away from home. It had everything you would need to cook, as well as bug face nets and bear spray. We love a blanket. Wifi was fast and the TV had plenty of channels incl all the streaming sites. There is no phone reception or 4G whatsoever once you get into the Adirondacks but there is in Gloversville. The nearest supermarket was only a 10 min drive away and is very well stocked and is open late.
Went kayaking around the lake every day and there are plenty of local hikes within 30 mins drive, bring plenty of bug spray. Saw plenty of wildlife including a bald eagle. Waking up to the sound of Loons is really special.
This is the perfect place to stay and Lori and Mark were really helpful and responsive, even sent us a video of a late-night bear visitor. I can't recommend this place and these hosts enough.
Loved our stay and want to return again..nice place to unwind and fully relax and enjoy the birds and view! Peaceful lake setting!

The Sleepy Loon Cottage was better than we could have hoped. Clean and inviting, the space is used perfectly. Very easy to check in and out. Mark and Lori were very to reach if needed.
The screened in back porch is fantastic. We snuggled up on the couch and watched a movie on our computer, right on the porch, when it rained. And we LOVED hearing the sounds of loons singing.
The bedrooms were clean and functional. We used the back bedroom since you can see the lake from the bed if you open the blinds.
The kitchen is great for cooking too. We decided to stay in to cook steak and potatoes that we picked up and the nearby grocery store.
The bathroom was very clean, including the shower. Great shower head too.
There's a small dock with chairs to sit and watch nature. And there was 2, sit on top, kayaks and a row boat also available to us. We saw loons, geese, beavers, and what we are almost sure was a mink.
We'll definitely be back! Thank you for a great stay!

Wow! What can we say, the cottage is simply awesome! It has everything you need and is super comfortable. The outside space is fantastic too. We saw loons, ducks, geese, eagles, woodpeckers, hummingbirds and most amazing of all, four beavers, Pork Chop and Posy of course plus two others which we have unofficially names as Cream Cheese and Bagel! Will always remember our morning coffee on the dock and kayak trips around the lake. This place is incredible and Lori and Mark are the perfect hosts. Have no doubts, just go!

Very relaxing stay enjoyed kayaking on the lake and hiking local trails in the area. Also enjoyed our visit to the town Woodstock and the historical site in Bethel.
Thanks for sharing!
This cabin is phenomenal! Extremely clean, well kept with great access to amazing views!

Lori and Mark's place was great. It has an amazing view and the place is tidy and spacious (the TV is actually bigger than it looks in the picture). Lori and Mark were also extremely communicative. I didn't have any issues at all, but have no doubt that if I did, they would have responded right away. I would definitely stay at their place again.
Beautiful cabin on a lake, greatly enjoyed the firepit, gorgeous views and excellent accomodations. Our favorite getaway!

We had a lovely time. This cottage is very well maintained and stocked. The area is quiet and restful like I've never experienced. Lori and Mark were super responsive and communicative both before and during the stay. It feels as though they thought of everything.
Seeing the sun rise over the lake is fantastic. The surrounding area is also full of things to see and do for nature lovers. We'd highly recommend!

The Sleepy Loon Cottage is a great spot to kick back and relax lake side. It is fully equipped with everything you would need. It has direct access to the lake and comes with two kayaks and a row boat. We enjoyed a peaceful Columbus weekend watching the sun rise. The beds were super comfy with plenty of bedding for a cool October weekend. The kitchen is fully stocked with pots and pans, coffee maker, keurig, grilling utensils. etc. It also has a nice screened in porch on the back overlooking the lake which would be awesome for a summer stay!

A classic, cozy, and thoughtfully renovated lakeside cabin in a great location that feels totally secluded, but is still convenient to grocery shopping and other necessities. Check-in and check-out were really simple and Lori and Mark were kind and responsive hosts.
My mom, who has some mobility issues, appreciated that the majority of the cottage, including one of the bedrooms, is on the same level. There's just one step up to get inside the front door. It might not be accessible to folks who use wheelchairs, but people who can navigate one or two steps as needed, including stepping into a combination shower-bath, should be all right staying here.
The beds were comfortable, thermostat worked well, and we never ran out of hot water even with three people showering in a row. The internet connection could handle streaming video without a problem. The stove is older, but it works perfectly.
Do be careful not to leave food lying around. It is a cabin in the woods, and four-legged neighbors might take advantage of any human snacks left out overnight.
Lori was a great host and very communicative. Being a private lake it was very quiet and great way to escape. Close enough to few local restaurants and bars. Definitely recommend.

A lovely getaway from the bustle of Boston to the woods! Cottage had everything I needed to feel comfortable for my stay. The peace and quiet was so rejuvenating! It was pretty rainy for most of my stay but that allowed for some beautiful rainbows, and getting to enjoy the yard, porch & dock while the rain dribbled down. I even took a nap during a storm on the porch, that was bliss! The fire starter sticks came in handy when I wanted to have a fire after a storm. Didn’t have any issues starting a fire with slightly damp wood & no kindling.
There was one small issue with the grill/propane tank, but Lori & Mark were fantastic with communication and getting me assistance to fix the issue. Really appreciate how attentive they were.
I saw other reviews mention the shed next door & neighbors, I didn’t see those neighbors, which could be due to my stay being mostly during the week. (Sunday - Thursday).
The lake is beautiful & clear. Lots of cool vegetation & water creatures to look for while out on the kayak.
Overall a really lovely experience, I really enjoyed my time at Sleepy Loon!
We were in town for a wedding. This was a very nice and quiet place to stay. Can’t beat the view! Very relaxing! Sitting on the dock was my favorite!

My husband and I had an amazing and relaxing stay at Sleepy Loon. Lori and Mark are excellent hosts and are very responsive to any question before and during our stay. Sleepy Loon was everything we wanted - peace, beautiful area, clean, friendly. We plan to return next year.

Really lovely stay at the Sleepy Loon! The cottage came with everything we needed for our visit (having ice in the freezer was much appreciated). The beds were comfy and everything was well appointed. Everything we were looking for in a quiet ADK stay, can't wait to return again.

Wonderful, relaxing cottage! The silence was indeed golden! We spent most of our time on the screened porch watching the beaver, herons and a bold eagle. The photos capture this magical place exactly. Lori and Mark were communication gems!

This is SUCH a cozy home! Loved relaxing here. We used the boats to paddle out to a raft in the middle of the pond. We parked the boat there and same off the raft. The water was a little deeper and less "stuff". Water right in front of home is a little grassy (may be just due to not a lot of water this season).
There are neighbors really close. Their home is technically across the street - but they have a shed and dock really close. They were there with a bunch of kids while we were so it was a little less "in the mountains" than we thought we'd feel. However, still extremely peaceful place to relax. Loved sipping coffee on the dock in the am and evening cocktail when the sun went down.
Great place for little kids too! We had a 14 month kiddo and he loved running through the grass. Nice dark curtains for rooms too. Suggest brining a gate for 1 stair case (we had one and was amazing!)
Beautiful wood features in home. The sit on top kayaks were SOO fun, really nice ones!
Great calm trip!
Mountain Hunt is a very short walk from house...fun little spot if you want to get out of the house for a meal.
Great location! We had a wonderful vacation. Thank you!
2nd year in a row we have brought the family here We will be back again Beautiful setting. Great communication by hosts.
We were looking for a few days to relax, unwind, and hang as a family- perfect location for this! Our host was very gracious, helpful, and provided a clean lovely home!

This is our second visit to Sleepy Loon! It was such a wonderful experience last year and did not disappoint this time. They even made improvements since our last visit. Lazy kayaking around this lovely lake was my favorite part. I suspect we will be back again next year for our annual connect-with-nature trip!
such a perfect cozy place to enjoy a peaceful gorgeous lake. highly recommend!

This is our first time booking with Air B&B and Mark & Lori definitely set the bar high! Our family had the best week at their gorgeous home! Pictures do not do this place justice - it is so beautiful and spacious. They thought of everything when they decorated and staged this cabin, literally everything you need is here!
The use of their boats (2 kayaks and a row boat) is incredibly generous and we had so much fun exploring the lake & fishing, which was excellent! We caught some monster large mouths & pickerel. The lake is so private and quiet - we enjoyed our morning drinking coffee on the dock, listening to the wildlife, and watching the steam roll off the water. There is plenty of perfectly seasoned firewood available.
The house is stocked with fluffy towels, pillows and linens. The couches and beds are so comfortable and there are views of the lake in every room. Our son (6) loved his little Harry Potter bedroom - so cute!
When they tell you Wemple & Edicks is a *must* for ice cream, trust them. It seriously is the most amazing homemade ice cream we’ve ever had!
There is no cell service (for AT&T at least) but the wifi was great. We downloaded and set up Google Voice to make calls over wifi and if you have iPhone then you can iMessage. We found random pockets in the middle of the lake with cell service 😆
Mark and Lori are always there to answer questions or check in. They are so sweet and kind - we feel like we made new friends! Already planning next summers trip back!

Words can not express what a wonderful place the SleepyLoon is. The surroundings are beautiful and quiet. The beds were so comfortable it made us feel like we were melted butter! Everything you need for a wonderful stay comes with the cabin. Very relaxing. The SleepyLoon was the most relaxing best vacation we have ever had. Everything provided is high quality from the furniture, bedding, kitchen supplies to the firewood! I HIGHLY recommend the SleepyLoon. Mark and Lori are wonderful hosts and answer any and all questions in a very timely manner. The dock was great and we really enjoyed the rowboat for evening rows as well as fishing! Check in and out was super easy! We can not wait to visit again!!!!! We enjoyed the wildlife as well. The beaver strolled by in the evening, A woodchuck ate it’s breakfast in the yard every morning. An owl serenaded us in the evening by the fire and the beautiful sounds of the loons filled the air! Absolutely one of the most relaxing places on earth!

The Host Lori and Mark were very helpful. The place was very nice. It had everything you would need. The view was beautiful. It was a great place to Kayak and fish. Loved sitting on the dock watching the beavers and seeing the loons. Very nice and quiet. The only thing was we couldn't swim, the lake was very low and it had weeds and algae.

The Sleepy Loon is a wonderful place to get away that isn’t too far away. You don’t need to pack much, this place has almost anything you will need. The lake is absolutely beautiful, with tons of birds. We loved the daily fly by of an eagle! Getting out on the lake in the kayaks is another way to see the wildlife. My son had a wonderful time fishing for bass. We had a wonderful time here at the Sleepy Loon.

We had a wonderful stay and it was very hard to leave. The location was stunning and the cottage was very clean and homey. Lori and Mark were extremely responsive and very kind! The neighborhood beaver was also a lovely host and checked on us every night. We hope we can come back soon!
Had a great time! Was nice and cozy. A nice little getaway, will definitely be back!

Photos don’t do this place justice! Very clean, comfy furniture and beds, hosts are amazing! If you want peace and solitude this is the place to go, if you want restaurants they are a short 20min drive away. There were loons, ducks, geese with babies, woodchucks, beavers, good fishing, and a tiny glimpse of a bear through the woods. Fires by the lake and evening kayak paddles are the best! This is a place that deserves repeat visits!

This home is honestly one of the loveliest places I have ever stayed. Lori and Mark were very helpful and quick to respond to any questions I may have had. I would absolutely stay again and I'm hopeful I will be able to find the time this summer to return. If you're at all hesitant, I would encourage you to book. You won't be disappointed.

Cute place to unwind and spend quality time with the family. The pond was beautiful. We enjoyed morning coffee by the water, kayaked all day, and roasted s’mores by the campfire at night. Local restaurants were also surprisingly good. I would definitely recommend staying. Lori and Mark were wonderful hosts, super helpful and kind!
This is a very nice place for a peaceful relaxing getaway! The chairs on the dock were my morning coffee and evening glass of wine spot! Comfortable and clean.

This is one of the best spots I have ever been to on Airbnb! We were so sad to have to leave after our four day stay. We barely left the house and we still felt like we didn't have enough time to do everything we wanted to do there!
As many have said, the backyard is absolutely the best feature - we loved watching the thunderstorms go by in the screened in porch and having our morning coffee out there listening to the birds. We used the BBQ to make lunch and enjoy at the picnic table and taking the rowboat and kayaks out on the calm and quiet lake was so restorative and fun. Watching the sunsets on the dock was so nice - we even saw some beavers swimming around and deer grabbing a drink at the lake at dusk each day! We also enjoyed the firepit and made some s'mores.
The beds and couches were super cozy and we had plenty of towels and blankets to use. The kitchen also had all the basics including salt, pepper, olive oil, etc.
It was so nice to feel away from it all yet an easy drive to get anything we needed from town. You're less than an hour from Saratoga and we saw a show at SPAC one night and visited the trails there on the way home.
Thank you for sharing your home with us! We loved this place and can't wait to come back!

Our stay was wonderful. Lori was very responsive, informative and accommodating.
The pictures do not do it justice. I would stay here again and again. The home and property are very well maintained and with just enough decorative touches to add charm inside and out!

What an amazing little oasis the sleepy loon cottage is. Designed beautifully, with a cozy rustic vibe that you immediately feel welcomed as you walk in. The cottage is so much more roomier than it appears from the outside.
It was the perfect place for a weekend getaway to unwind, relax, fish, and kayak. The screened in back porch offered great views of the lake and all the surrounding wildlife.
Lori and Mark are wonderfully kind hosts. Their communication and responsiveness went above and beyond that of an other Airbnb host.
We hope to book another stay at the sleepy loon cottage next summer.

I am more than happy to write this positive review after our beautiful stay at the Sleepy Loon Cottage. Just arriving at this place was a treat as it was at the end of a quiet road so no through traffic to be concerned about. The check-in was simple and fast. We were impressed with how clean and neat everything was inside and out. Walking in the door and looking around, the theme felt very comfortable, clean and inviting, we really felt at home. The non-motorized Lake was a huge bonus so we could really listen to the wildlife instead of boats and jet skis. It's so peaceful at dusk as the day ends on the lake and all you can hear is the sounds of the crickets chirping and the wails of the Loons. Sitting on the dock, enjoying the view of the Lake and listening to nature was truly peaceful and decompressing. The screened-in porch overlooking the lake was such a bonus. Lori and Mark were great Hosts and communicated well with us. This is what we really needed to relax and decompress from the daily grind. Great Job Lori & Mark, Thank You!!!

Out of all of the places I've stayed at through Airbnb, this is easily one of my favorites! Being able to wake up every morning and sit out on the back patio listening to the sounds of nature was so relaxing. The cabin has everything you need for a very comfortable stay, but it's really the backyard that makes this place magic. Highly recommend staying here if you're looking to disconnect from a busy life and reconnect with nature.
beautiful place. not many nice places let you stay with dogs.

This is the perfect place to unplug and unwind. I have a very busy, loud job, and was looking for an escape to peace and quiet. This place did not disappoint! I can tell from other reviewers that there are plenty of places to go and things to do if your are interested, but personally I never left. I just soaked in all the peace and quiet surrounded by nature. The sunrises are stunning if you are up that early, and the view of the lake any time of day is amazing! If you need a quiet to place to unwind and relax, this is definitely the place for you! I can't wait to go back again next year!

Really excellent cabin directly on the lake--we were very comfortable and enjoyed the grill, waterside firepit, and rowboat! Place was very clean and hosts were communicative. Full kitchen setup with everything we could want--oven, range, toaster, microwave, full size fridge. Lovely place and a great stay!

Lovely quiet spot on the water. We were not there very much during The day, but it looks like an enjoyable place especially in summer. The television did not work upon arrival, and the host had ordered a new one which came during our stay. We did not have the tools to put the stand together and they did not have anyone to do it. No matter as we brought books to read. Might be a good idea to have a person available for things like this. We did appreciate that our dog was allowed and that the beds were comfortable. Thanks for sharing your spot.

Very nice little cottage in a very quiet area. Nice hiking around. Quiet and Serene. Place was clean and the kitchen was stocked with most anything you could need to cook for yourself. Laundry on site was convenient just remember your detergent. The outside enclosed porch was awesome and the lake view is really pretty. Would definitely stay here again.

We had a wonderful, relaxing weekend at this adorable lakeside cottage! It was clean, well stocked, and smelled of fresh pine. The views, of the lake and fall foliage were delightful! This place is a little slice of heaven!

I have already writs one review but can’t help but write another! This cottage is the absolute BEST place to completely relax and unwind. It’s so peaceful. Tons of hikes nearby to do as well. Kane Mountain was awesome! The cottage has everything you need and Lori and Mark are fabulous to work with. We will be back again for sure!!
Fantastic location and cabin. We had an amazing time. Quiet indeed and perfect to recharge in nature. We’ll be back!

Our stay at the Sleepy Loon Cottage was wonderful. Color was just starting to appear in the woods and mountains surrounding us (late September visit). We really liked being on the end of the street with just a few cottages nearby. No through traffic. So quiet yet we didn’t feel secluded from the world. The cottage itself had all we needed for a relaxing stay…fun having lake front and for us such a bonus being able to use the John boat (all 3 of us fit in plus our little dog) and kayaks. Signed the waivers on line and off we went! 🤗. No motor boats on the lake was sweet. We rowed from one end of the lake to the other. Released the fish we caught but catching them was fun. Had a great time roasting hot dogs, and just sitting around, the fire pit. We even saw a beaver!! We read one review that suggested Wemple and Edicks country store in Sammonsville for their baked good and ice cream. Wow! Great suggestion. We ordered a home made apple pie. It was gone within a day🤗.
Mark and Lori, hats off to you for your warm communications, hospitality and generosity. The cottage was great…the boat and kayaks were icing on the cake.

Lori and Mark were phenomenal. So communicative and kind. Sunsets and sunrises at their place were breathtaking. It was fun to watch the beavers and listen to the coyotes and variety of birds in the area. I would highly recommend breakfast at Nanny and Pop's. The food was great and the staff was so nice. If you are looking for a true escape I highly recommend the Sleepy Loon. The kids and I were so happy and can't wait to go back.

Lori and Mark were very good hosts the cottage was very cute and we enjoyed hanging out on the lake and had fun kayaking and going out in the row boat and at night we had a nice bomb fire and enjoyed looking at the stars thanks again for your hospitality

Our stay at Sleepy Loon Cottage was everything we’d hoped for and more; from the moment we pulled up, to the moment we drove away with sentimental attachment to the loons. The cottage itself was beautiful, and offered anything we might need. (I brought with me a bag of garden vegetables for making soup, and found everything I would need, from quality knives to pans, and gorgeous pottery bowls for eating! If you cook, you know that’s very cool).
Absolutely everything we sat on, slept on, or dried off with felt like quality comfort. What can I possibly say about waking up to a fresh gentle breeze, and a view of the water from your bed?
Much of our time was spent on the screened in front porch, staring at the water, enjoying the complete peace and serenity of the place, and a view like that of a Kincaid painting...and then we took the kayaks they had available, and paddled right into that painting. It was absolutely breathtaking.
We had a very positive experience, and are happy that we chose Sleepy Loon Cottage for our family vacation.

Sleepy Loon is such a gem!
The cottage is comfortable and surprisingly spacious. My family of 5 was able to spread out on rainy days without feeling cramped.
The house includes everything you’ll need, keep these things in mind:
~Instacart delivers! No need to leave if you prefer to stay onsite.
~ Life jackets are included. Small adult life jackets fit my teeny 10 & 7 year olds, for younger kids bring your puddle jumpers.
~ If your dog tends to run away, bring a leash and stake. There’s no fencing.
~ If you prefer not to hand wash , bring disposable plates and utensils. The cottage does not include a dishwasher.
~ In the interior only the bathroom door locks. Nothing to bring except creativity, particularly if you have young children.
Internet is limited to the house and surrounding area. Once you hit the road, it takes a while for internet to pick back up. Plan accordingly if you need directions back to the house from a trail!
We did have limited water the first few days. Mike and Lori provided clear instructions for getting the water to flow. After a few days there were no hiccups and water flowed like normal.
Lori and Mike are incredibly responsive and a pleasure to talk with.
The cottage is at the end of a dirt road. The neighbors were hardly ever around and when they were, they weren’t very visible. The immediate lot next door only has a shed with the main house behind the cottage. Overall, it feels very private.
Cooperstown and Saratoga Springs are nearby (~60 minutes) and fun to explore.
If you’re going to Cooperstown Origins Cafe is highly recommended for a unique dining experience.
Not enough words to describe the incredible experience available at Sleepy Loon.

This is such a dreamy cabin! We spent five days and hardly ever left other than for pretty walks on the backroads. The screened in porch is such a great hang spot for early morning coffee. The kitchen is well equipped for cooking and the house is perfectly furnished!

This cottage is a great getaway for someone that wants a very quiet and relaxed vacation. It comes as advertised as a very secluded place with only a couple neighbors on one side of you ( which we never even saw). The house was fully equipped with everything you would need. It was a short trip into Gloversville/Johnstown each day for food or a trip to Walmart if needed. We went to Saratoga one day as well and it was an easy 45 minute drive. Mark and Lori were extremely quick to respond or check in. I would give this place the highest rating for the cost! Thank you

You will not be disappointed when staying at the Sleepy Loon Cottage.
The waterfront screened porch provides a wonderful setting for bird watching and to watch the ever changing water.
The Cottage has a well equipped kitchen, it is very comfortable and spacious.
Thank you for the wonderful vacation.

We had an amazing stay at the Sleepy Loon. Mark and Lori are amazing hosts and answered all of my questions promptly. The fishing, kayaking, campfires, and wildlife made for an unforgettable trip. The location is premiere and quiet. It was everything I needed to get away from the hectic day to day grind. The ducks, geese, deer, birds, coyotes, beavers, and of course, the loons provided countless encounters. I hope to stay again soon.

Traveling to the Sleepy Loon Cottage was one of my best travel experiences ever. I was so sad to leave, and am still recovering from the “Sleepy Loon Blues”.
As for the home itself, it is immaculate and clearly well cared for. The kitchen was fully equipped with everything you could possibly need for your stay. This came in handy as all meals were cooked at home and there was no shortage of supplies. The two bedrooms are the perfect size, the beds are VERY comfortable, and the bedding itself was very nice. There is even a cute little “nap nook” with a twin bed, perfect for children or cozy naps. The bathroom is at the front of the house, which is wonderful for privacy. The water pressure in the shower was strong and there was never any issue with hot water running out or anything like that. The screened in porch was clutch for rainy days and night time. You can still enjoy the beauty of the location without subjecting yourself to the elements! I do agree with previous reviews that this home is much bigger than it looks in pictures.
The property itself is beyond priceless. The lake is so quiet, private and peaceful. The backyard is a great size and equipped with a picnic table, campfire, dock, Adirondack chairs, grill and more. The front yard has a beautiful little outdoor dining patio and stunningly gorgeous flowers surrounding. The cottage comes with two kayaks, and a row boat. This was just an added bonus as it truly enhanced the experience at Lake Edward. There was awesome fishing, beautiful sunsets, and breathtaking sunrises. It was truly special to be able to enjoy a cup of hot coffee on the dock while watching the sun come up.
The location is wonderful and within driving distance to many beautiful nature escapes. I enjoyed hiking Kane Mountain and Tenant Falls. I did not explore much in terms of nightlife or restaurants, as this was more of a nature getaway for me. I did venture out to the general store which is right down the street and Walmart which was only a 15 minute drive. The location of this cottage provided exactly what I was looking for.
As far as the hosts go, I truly cannot say enough about how incredible Lori and Mark were. Connecting and communicating with them truly enhanced my stay as I have never experienced such warm and gracious hosts. Their love for their home is both evident and contagious, which made the stay even more personal and memorable. I loved chatting with them throughout the stay and sharing photos. They expressed such genuine enthusiasm for the experience I was having that it just made me love it that much more. They were quick to respond to any and all communications and always responded with kindness and warmth.
I have traveled the world and have stayed many places. I’ve never felt the way I felt leaving the Sleepy Loon. This cottage, along with Mark and Lori, will forever have a special place in my heart. Both the cottage and the hosts made me feel so at home, which made it that much harder to leave. I highly encourage anyone and everyone to book this stay. You will not regret it and you will be forever changed because of it. I will certainly be spending more time at the Sleepy Loon in the future, and am already looking forward to booking a return trip. I feel truly honored to have had the opportunity to experience such an incredible place. I am forever grateful to Lori and Mark for sharing their slice of paradise with me.

Sleepy Loom is an absolute gem. This little lake house is at the end of a small drive on a lovely, quiet lake (no motorized boats allowed and opposite shore completely undeveloped). As two couples we were very comfortable between the screened in porch (plenty of seating), the spacious kitchen, and the backyard picnic table and fire pit. The cabin seems recently renovated and is very clean. The best part of our stay was taking the two kayaks and the row boat out in the morning and at sunset. We didn’t end up swimming much, but in warmer weather I’d recommend bringing a raft to float out past the lilly pads to a nice clear swimming spot. Highly recommend the Sleepy Loon.
We had a wonderful stay! Lori provided everything we needed and checked it to make sure we were comfortable! Will be back!

Our stay at Sleepy Loon Cottage was fantastic thanks to Lori and Mark! The cottage had everything we needed, the kitchen came complete with all cooking utensils and appliances (even spices), you would need to provide the comforts of home while away.
Lori and Mark’s communication throughout our stay was wonderful, they were extremely responsive and ready to answer any questions we had. The beds were super comfy and we were provided with a plethora of towels, linens etc! The lake was beautiful, the wildlife was awesome, we were greeted by ducks and loons, and even heard coyotes at night! So cool!
There is a beautiful breeze that comes off the lake during the day, keeping the cottage a comfortable temperature for summer months, and it was not as buggy as we had anticipated, although we did keep a campfire going (which helped). The cottage was very clean, well stocked and extremely spacious! The woodwork was beautiful too!
We brought our pup, and the cottage proved to be very pet friendly! Our pup LOVED jumping off the dock and swimming in the lake, there was so much for him to do! The neighbors were extremely friendly as well, overall very good vibes all around!
Our only regret is we didn’t book a longer stay at Sleepy Loon! We will most certainly my book a stay with Lori and Mark again!!

Our stay at Sleepy Loon was great. It’s at the end of a non motorized lake. It was fun to go out on the kayaks and explore the wildlife. The cabin was very well appointed and we especially liked the screened in porch. Lori and Mark were very helpful.

The Sleepy Loon is a beautiful cottage in an idyllic setting. The house was clean, comfortable and it's clear that the hosts care about their guests stay. Both an easy check in process and responsive hosts made it a wonderful trip. PS- you may fall in love with the local loons, so neat!!
Great wildlife viewing all around the lake.

The Sleepy Loon Cottage is a great destination for a relaxing getaway. I highly recommend.
I stayed for 4 nights in June with my girlfriend and really enjoyed the space. Lori was a very clear and responsive host.
Cottage Tips
- Very spacious and has what you need for cooking, etc.
- Large main room with open layout
- TV has Roku
- Quiet, private and peaceful space inside and out
- Screened back porch is great for rainy days
- Propane grill is in great condition
- Kayaking on the lake is really nice
Area Tips
- About 20 mins. away from the main areas of Gloversville and Johnstown. Both worth a visit.
- Bowman's has really good meat (I got bacon burgers, steak and spare ribs)
- Upstate Coffee and Second Wind Coffee are good (Upstate also has some groceries, Second Wind is more of a coffee shop vibe)
- Can't recommend any restaurants since we grilled for all meals
- The Kane Mountain Trail in Shaker Mountain Wild Forest is a nice moderate hike
Hope you get a chance to enjoy it as much as we did!

This is a beautiful retreat. The lake is gorgeous. It was nice to sit on the back porch and watch the wildlife. We comfortably slept 3 adults, 3 children and and an infant. The host was responsive and very helpful. We definitely hope to return.

This cabin is really really cozy, but somehow spacious at the same time! (It definitely feels bigger than it looks in the listing.) It's so cute, stocked with everything you need, has a lovely common area to hang out in, and the beds are very comfy. We were pleasantly surprised at how cool it stayed inside during a fairly hot day, and we loved sitting on the screen porch and watching nature (saw several beavers as well as loons and deer). The cabin is located out of the way but in a small cluster of homes on the lake, still very peaceful but with the comfort of civilization nearby; it's a short (beautiful!) drive into town, which is honestly super cute and not nearly as small as I expected. So close to a ton of great trails etc., though our favorite activities were relaxing at the cabin and fishing off the dock. I appreciated the clear communication upfront & quick check ins from Lori and Mark, definitely felt like they were available for anything we needed.
Overall, this is genuinely a great value ESPECIALLY for this region. It's a lovely place to stay in a very cool part of the southern Adirondacks.
FYIs:
-We found the bugs to be no problem when the breeze was blowing off the lake, but otherwise you'll need some bug spray.
-Internet works fine, but can be a bit slow at times; generally, I'd recommend only one device on the internet at a time, and don't expect to be able to download content. That said, I did a whole Zoom call at one point with no problems.
-All internal doors are sliding or folding, so sound does carry a bit, which we actually liked because we could hang out in separate areas and still feel like we were together. The bathroom is also on the far side of the cabin from the bedrooms, so there is more privacy there. One of us went on the screen porch when we really needed quiet.

Sleepy Loon Cottage is the the perfect name for the perfect place to completely relax and unwind! And unplug! The camp has been recently renovated and it is airtight and super clean. Lori was great to work with. I highly recommend this camp!!
